description: A scrollable list that displays data items in cells, one per row. Cells are created on demand by the *createCell* callback and reused on scrolling.

itemHeight.description: The height of a collection cell. If set to a function, this function will be called for every item, providing the item and the cell type as parameters, and must return the item height for the given item.

items.description: An array of data items to be displayed by the collection view. For dynamic content, use the methods `insert` and `remove` instead of setting this property directly.

createCell.description: A callback used to create a new collection cell for a given type. This callback will be called by the framework and the created cell will be reused for different items. The cell should be populated in a *itemChanged* listener.

initializeCell.description: A callback used to initialize a collection cell by attaching widgets and a *itemChanged* listener.

cellType.description: The name of the cell type to use for a given item. This name will be passed to the `createCell`, `initializeCell`, and `itemHeight` functions. Cells will be reused only for those items that map to the same cell type. If set to a function, this function will be called for every item, providing the item as a parameter, and must return a name for the cell type to use for the given item.

refreshEnabled.description: Enables the user to trigger a refresh by using the pull-to-refresh gesture.

refreshIndicator.description: Whether the refresh indicator is currently visible. Will be set to `true` when a *refresh* event is triggered. Reset it to `false` when the refresh is finished.

refreshMessage.description: The message text displayed together with the refresh indicator. Currently not supported on Android.

firstVisibleIndex.description: The first item that is currently visible on screen.

lastVisibleIndex.description: The last item that is currently visible on screen.

columnCount.description: The number of columns to display in the collection view. If set to a value `n > 1`, each row will contain `n` items. The available space will be equally distributed between columns.

select.description: Fired when a collection item is selected.

index.description: The index of the selected item.

refresh.description: Fired when the user requested a refresh. An event listener should reset the *refreshIndicator* property when refresh is finished.

scroll.description: Fired while the collection view is scrolling.

deltaY.description: The delta of the scroll position. Positive when scrolling up and negative when scrolling down.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The position to insert the items at. If a negative index is given, it is interpreted as relative to the end. If the given index is greater than the item count, new items will be appended at the end.

insert.description: Inserts the given items into this view at the given index or at the end if none is specified. This operation will modify the *items* property.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index of the first item to remove. If this is negative, it is interpreted as relative to the end.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of items to remove.

remove.description: Removes one or, if specified, *count* items beginning with the given index from this view. This operation will modify the *items* property.

refresh.description: Triggers a refresh of all visible items. This will issue *itemChanged* events on the corresponding cells.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index of the item that was changed.

refresh.description: Triggers a refresh of the item with the given index. If the item is scrolled into view, a *itemChanged* event will be issued on the corresponding cell.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index of the item to reveal. If this is negative, it is interpreted as relative to the end

reveal.description: Scrolls the item with the given index into view.
